alert.note: Alert for Antelope Valley; Santa Clarita Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 08 at 2:21AM PST until November 09 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING FOR THE RECENT BURN AREAS IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible over the recent burn scars in Los Angeles County. * WHERE...Portions of the Los Angeles County Mountains, Antelope Valley, San Gabriel Valley, and Santa Clarita Valley in and below the Fish, Route, Bobcat, Ranch2, Dam, and Lake burn scars. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall may develop across the recent burn scars in Los Angeles County, bringing the risk of flash flooding and debris flows, as well as rockslides. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Peak rainfall rates of 0.50 to 0.75 inch per hour are forecasted for the watch area, with local rates to between 1.00 and 1.50 inches per hour possible in favored upslope locations and near thunderstorms. Short-duration bursts of rainfall are possible with a few locations receiving 0.50 to 0.75 inch in about 20 to 30 minutes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Those living in and near burn areas should follow the directions of emergency officials. If near a burn area, be prepared to shelter-in-place in the highest level of your home or business when a flash flood warning is issued.
